decks.notes: This deck is focused on utilizing low-cost, efficient spells to power out strong threats at a rapid pace. By using cards like Lightning Bolt and Vapor Snag to control the board and disrupt your opponent's plans, while also fueling the graveyard with cards like Thought Scour and Gitaxian Probe to power out Tarmogoyf and Delver of Secrets. Snapcaster Mage provides additional value by allowing you to recast your best spells, while Hooting Mandrills and Young Pyromancer provide additional threats to close out the game quickly. The deck seeks to maintain a fast, aggressive tempo to overwhelm opponents.

The deck focuses on quickly playing Merfolk creatures with abilities that buff each other, control the opponent's board with bouncing and counterspells, and disrupt their mana base with land destruction. By using Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and Cavern of Souls to make them uncounterable, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression and maintain tempo through card advantage and disruptive spells. The blend of aggression, disruption, and tribal synergy makes this Merfolk deck a formidable force in the Modern format.

The main focus of this Jund Aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand and board while applying pressure with efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant. The deck aims to control the game through a combination of discard spells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil. The deck puts a strong emphasis on card advantage and resource management, using cards like Kolaghan's Command and Scavenging Ooze to generate value while keeping the opponent on the back foot. It is designed to be versatile and adaptable to different matchups, with a mix of disruption and aggression.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of Merfolk creatures, utilizing cards like Harbinger of the Tides and Master of Waves to control the board and create multiple tokens. By buffing up their creatures with cards like Master of the Pearl Trident and Lord of Atlantis, the deck aims to deal large amounts of damage in a short amount of time. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Spreading Seas and Tidebinder Mage allows for disruption of the opponent's strategy, giving the Merfolk player an advantage in the match.

The deck is focused on assembling a board presence quickly and efficiently, utilizing low-cost artifacts and creatures with powerful synergies. By leveraging cards like Arcbound Ravager, Steel Overseer, and Cranial Plating, the deck can pump out huge amounts of damage in a short amount of time. The inclusion of cards like Thoughtcast and Springleaf Drum helps to keep the hand full of threats and mana available. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive strategy and close out games before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a combination of cheap artifacts and aggressive creatures. By using various artifact synergies such as Cranial Plating and Arcbound Ravager, the deck aims to deal large amounts of damage quickly and efficiently. The key to this deck is to play aggressively and utilize the artifact creatures' abilities to their full potential, while also utilizing cards like Galvanic Blast for direct damage. The deck also includes some protection with cards like Etched Champion and Spellskite to maintain board presence and push for victory.

The main concept of this Aggro Red Deck Wins archetype is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using efficient and cheap spells and creatures, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early on and finish the game before they have a chance to stabilize. Cards like Atarka's Command and Boros Charm provide additional reach and burn spells like Lava Spike and Lightning Bolt help close out the game. The mana base is optimized for a fast and consistent mana curve.

This Naya Zoo deck focuses on quick, aggressive creature plays combined with burn spells to deal damage as quickly as possible. The key concept revolves around playing efficient, low-cost creatures like Goblin Guide, Wild Nacatl, and Tarmogoyf alongside powerful spells such as Atarka's Command and Lightning Bolt to quickly overwhelm the opponent and finish the game before they have a chance to stabilize. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent while utilizing removal spells like Path to Exile to clear the way for your creatures to continue to attack.

This deck focuses on using creatures with powerful abilities to create a toolbox of options for different situations. By using cards like Collected Company and Chord of Calling, the player can search for specific creatures to counter the opponent's strategies or strengthen their own board presence. Cards like Eternal Witness and Anafenza, Kin-Tree Spirit allow for recursion and combo potential, while Gavony Township provides a way to pump up creatures for the win. This deck is versatile and adaptive, capable of adapting to various matchup scenarios.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to control the opponent's hand, while also utilizing removal spells like Path to Exile and Relic of Progenitus to deal with threats. The Eldrazi creatures, such as Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer, are used to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. The mana base is built around Eldrazi Temple and Eye of Ugin to efficiently cast the powerful Eldrazi creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible by using low-cost creatures and burn spells. The deck focuses on efficiency and speed, aiming to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to establish their own game plan. It also includes cards that can prevent the opponent from gaining life or disrupting the deck's strategy. Overall, this deck prioritizes a fast-paced, aggressive approach to win the game before the opponent can respond effectively.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly get powerful creatures like Griselbrand or Borborygmos Enraged onto the battlefield using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Through the Breach. The deck utilizes various ways to fill up the graveyard with creatures and then reanimate them for a quick win. It also includes spells like Faithless Looting and Serum Visions to dig through the deck for key pieces. The deck aims to disrupt opponents with cards like Blood Moon while setting up its combo to win the game in a fast and explosive manner.

This deck aims to quickly and aggressively win by infecting the opponent with poison counters. It utilizes low-cost creatures with infect abilities, pump spells to increase their power and toughness, and protection spells to ensure they can get through to deal damage. The inclusion of cards like Become Immense and Groundswell allows for explosive plays, while cards like Spellskite and Apostle's Blessing provide protection. The mana base is optimized for consistent and fast play, allowing the deck to operate efficiently and effectively in a competitive Modern environment.

This Merfolk aggro deck focuses on flooding the board with powerful Merfolk creatures, supported by lords like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident to boost their strength. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Harbinger of the Tides and Cursecatcher to control the opponent's board. With cards like Aether Vial and Mutavault providing additional flexibility and mana acceleration, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of aggressive Merfolk creatures to secure a swift victory.

The main concept of this deck is to apply pressure on the opponent quickly and efficiently through aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Hooting Mandrills, and Delver of Secrets, while also disrupting their game plan with counterspells like Stubborn Denial and Mana Leak. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Vapor Snag, while also utilizing card draw and selection with Gitaxian Probe and Serum Visions. The deck's mana base allows for flexibility in casting spells of different colors, making it a versatile and adaptable aggro deck.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play low-cost creatures and use burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. By utilizing efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Tarmogoyf alongside burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Atarka's Command, the deck aims to apply pressure early in the game and overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive playstyle, while also providing access to a variety of colors for versatile spell casting. The deck seeks to win through fast and relentless attacks backed up by direct damage spells.
